title: AWS RDS PostgreSQL storage almost full but tables show very small size [closed]
text:
I’m using AWS RDS PostgreSQL and repeatedly seeing this event:

“Storage size 20 GiB is approaching the maximum storage threshold 22 GiB.”

However, when I inspect the database using DataGrip & AWS RDS Log, all user tables appear to be only KB in size, and I don’t see any large tables.

Aws RDS Log, Actual DB Size

My questions:

  1. What contributes to AWS RDS storage usage besides visible table data?

  2. How can this issue be resolved without deleting tables or actual data?

  3. What are best practices to prevent this from happening again in the future?
